summary: A press statement from Manhattan U.S. Attorney Geoffrey S. Berman announcing the death of Jeffrey Epstein by apparent suicide in his cell at the Manhattan Correctional Center. The statement confirms the ongoing investigation into sex trafficking charges and urges victims to come forward.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued the official statement announcing Jeffrey Epstein's death and reaffirming the commitment to the ongoing investigation and support for victims.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The accused who faced federal sex trafficking charges, found unresponsive in his cell and pronounced dead of an apparent suicide.

connections.description: Berman, as the U.S. Attorney, was the lead federal prosecutor overseeing the criminal case against Epstein.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Manhattan Correctional Center and pronounced dead shortly thereafter of an apparent suicide.

events.title: Ongoing Federal Investigation
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office states its investigation into the sex trafficking conspiracy charges against Epstein remains ongoing despite his death.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein died by apparent suicide in his cell at the Manhattan Correctional Center.
The death was confirmed by the Manhattan U.S. Attorney's Office on the morning it occurred.
Epstein was facing federal charges of sex trafficking of minors, including a conspiracy count.
The U.S. Attorney stated the investigation into the conduct charged remains ongoing.
Victims and individuals with information were urged to contact the FBI.
